verses.text: 作使徒的保羅，
verses.heading: Salutation

verses.text: 和所有與我在一起的弟兄，寫信給加拉太的眾教會。

words.note: Combined 'older brother' and 'younger brother' to mean brothers.

verses.text: 願恩惠平安從我們的父 神和主耶穌基督臨到你們。
基督照著我們父 神的旨意，曾經為我們的罪捨己，為的是要救我們脫離現在這邪惡的世代。

words.note: Refers to divine will or purpose.
Often followed by 是 (shì) to emphasize purpose.

verses.text: 願榮耀歸給他，直到永永遠遠。阿們。

words.note: Intensified form of 永遠 (yǒngyuǎn) meaning 'forever'.

verses.text: 我很驚奇，你們這麼快就離開了藉著基督的恩呼召你們的那一位，去歸向別的福音。

words.note: Indicates a high degree of speed.
To depart from a place or situation.
To turn or return to something/someone.

verses.heading: Occasion of the Letter

verses.text: 其實那並不是另一個福音，只是有些攪擾你們的人，想把基督的福音改變。

words.note: Often used to reinforce a negative statement.

verses.text: 但無論是我們，或是從天上來的使者，如果傳給你們的和我們以前傳給你們的福音不同，他就該受咒詛。

words.note: A messenger or envoy, often divine.
Refers to a time in the past.

verses.text: 我們已經說過，現在我要再說，如果有人傳給你們的和你們以前所領受的福音不同，他就該受咒詛。

words.note: Indicates an action completed in the past.
Refers to a time in the past.
Precedes a verb to form a nominal phrase.
To accept or take possession of something.

verses.text: 我現在是要得人的歡心，還是要得 神的歡心呢？難道我想討人歡喜嗎？如果我仍然要討人歡喜，就不是基督的僕人了。

words.note: Used to offer choices in a question.
Used for rhetorical questions, 'Can it be that...?'
To be happy, pleased, or to make others happy.
Indicates continuation of a state or action.
To be happy, pleased, or to make others happy.
A bondsman or one who serves.

verses.text: 弟兄們，我要你們知道，我所傳的福音，並不是照著人的意思，

words.note: Used before a verb to form a noun phrase.

words.definition: is not at all, definitely not

verses.heading: Paul’s Vindication of His Apostleship

verses.text: 因為這福音我不是從人領受的，也不是人教導我的，而是藉著耶穌基督的啟示來的。

words.note: Emphasizes the source or manner of an action.
Emphasizes the source or manner of an action.
Often used with '來' to indicate origin or means.

verses.text: 你們聽過我從前在猶太教中所行的：怎樣極力逼迫殘害 神的教會，

words.note: Used before a verb to form a noun phrase.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause.
The preceding space/character is used to show reverence for God.

verses.text: 怎樣在猶太教中比許多本族同輩的人更激進，為我祖先的傳統分外熱心。
然而，當我在母腹裡就把我分別出來，又用他的恩呼召我的那一位，

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Forms a modifying phrase for the following noun.
A respectful way to refer to God or an important person.

verses.text: 既然樂意把自己的兒子啟示給我，使我可以在外族人中傳揚他，我就沒有和任何人（「人」原文作「肉和血」）商量，

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for divine revelation.
Refers to non-Jewish people, often translated as 'Gentiles' in the Bible.
Commonly used for proclaiming the gospel or message.
Biblical idiom for human beings or human nature.

verses.text: 也沒有上耶路撒冷見那些比我先作使徒的，卻去了阿拉伯，然後再回到大馬士革。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'; refers to an emissary of Christ.

verses.text: 過了三年，我才上耶路撒冷去見磯法，和他住了十五天。
至於其餘的使徒，除了主的弟弟雅各以外，我都沒有見過。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'; refers to an emissary of Christ.
Often used for God or Jesus in the Bible.

verses.text: 在 神面前我敢說，我寫給你們的都不是謊話。

words.note: The preceding character `　` is a reverence space/symbol, not part of the word itself.

verses.text: 後來，我到了敘利亞和基利家一帶的地方。
那時，在基督裡的猶太眾教會還沒有見過我的面，
不過聽說「那個從前迫害我們的，現在竟然傳揚他以前所殘害的信仰」，

words.note: Often refers to spreading religious teachings.
Forms a noun phrase when placed before a verb and '的'.

verses.text: 他們就因著我的緣故頌讚 神。

words.note: Refers to the God of the Bible. Often reverently preceded by a space.
